generate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: a useful technique for generating new ideas
The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
Tourism generates income for local communities.
generate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to produce heat, electricity, or another form of energy
generate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Wind turbines generate electricity for the local community.
generate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: These solar panels generate enough electricity to supply a home with all its energy requirements.
The water goes first to generate hydroelectric power and then to irrigate the land.
generate.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to do something that will produce or increase sales, income, profit etc
generate.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The Clariant sale generated proceeds of FFr2.3 billion.
The business failed to generate sufficient revenue to cover its operating and capital costs.
the percentage of sales generated abroad
